The Early College Program evolved from Brenau Academy, which was founded in 1928 as a college preparatory boarding and day school for young women in grades nine through twelve. In 2011 the Academy transformed into the Early College program, which offers exceptional high school-age students the opportunity to take college classes and earn college credits through the University.Auxiliary enterprises - Enrichment programs and other support for the instructional programs of the University.
Student Services Programs: The University provides services to students, such as residences, bookstore, printing, parking, and food services. (11,717 Students)
Scholarship Programs: The University receives donations specifically to provide scholarships and bursaries to its students to encourage continued learning. (11,717 Students)

column6: PUBLIC SERVICE: Hendricks Center for Christian Leadership and Cultural Engagement pursues the development of effective Christian leadership in order to build leaders of integrity and impact. column5: NON-PROFIT EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTION SPECIALIZING IN THE FIELD OF HUMANITIES AND OFFERS DISTANCE EDUCATION THROUGH E-LEARNING AND M-LEARNING TO AKK INDEPENDENT SELF-LEARNERS IN THE WORLD. SUPPORTS INDEPENDENT LIFELONG LEARNING IN THE FIELD OF HUMANITIES. THE HUMANITIES INSTITUTE WAS FOUNDED IN ORDER TO PROVIDE, AT NO COST IN ANY OF ITS COURSES OR PROGRAMS, OPPORTUNITIES FOR ADVANCED STUDY IN THE LIBERAL ARTS TO THOSE WHO FOR VARIOUS REASONS ARE UNABLE TO PURSUE CONVENTIONAL FORMS OF EDUCATION. HUMANITIES UNIVERSITY "OPEN COURSE WARE" OFFERS HIGH QUALITY COURSE MATERIALS IN ORDER TO MAKE ONLINE EDUCATION IN THE HUMANITIES AVAILABLE TO ALL INDEPENDENT LEARNERS THROUGHOUT THE WORLD AT NO COST TO THE STUDENT.

Dsc: Communities in Transformation (CIT):In 2013 Communities in Transformation had the opportunity to make an impact on the lives of children and teens by providing core essential curriculum taught 3 hours weekly in apartment community after school programs. Through partners we also provided scholarships to WinShape Camps for children in apartment communities. We provided core essentials which were taught weekly as well as providing teacher training to a public elementary school for their students. Communities in Transformation served people through providing meals and relationship building in a Boys and Girls Club in inner City Atlanta.

column5: RESEARCH: THE CENTER FOR THE STUDY OF THEOLOGICAL EDUCATION (CSTE) SERVES ALL RELIGIOUS GROUPS AND IS THE ONLY RESEARCH INSTITUTE DEVOTED SOLELY TO THEOLOGICAL EDUCATION. THE APPLIED RESEARCH AND CONSULTING IT CONDUCTS BUILDS KNOWLEDGE BENEFITTING INSTITUTIONS THAT EDUCATE RELIGIOUS LEADERS AS WELL AS THEIR STAKEHOLDERS. CSTE IDENTIFIES AND EXPLORES KEY ISSUES SUCH AS STUDENT LIFE AND DEBT, EDUCATIONAL AND ADMINISTRATIVE LEADERSHIP, FACULTY AND CURRICULUM, FINANCES AND THE PUBLIC ROLE OF THEOLOGICAL SCHOOLS. CSTE CONSULTANTS HELP SCHOOLS EVALUATE PROGRAMS, DEVELOP STRATEGIES, FORGE NEW INSTITUTIONAL PARTNERSHIPS, ACHIEVE FINANCIAL STABILITY, AND SUPPORT THEIR SENIOR LEADERSHIP. NEW ACTION ORIENTED RESEARCH IS EXPLORING THE INTERCONNECTED ISSUES OF RELIGIOUS LEADERSHIP IN THE CONTEXT OF CHANGING RELIGIOUS LIFE IN AMERICA AND THE IMPLICATIONS FOR THEOLOGICAL EDUCATION.CSTE REPORTS, PUBLICATIONS AND VIDEOS ON CRITICAL ISSUES AND PROBLEMS IN GRADUATE-LEVEL THEOLOGICAL EDUCATION ARE WIDELY DISTRIBUTED IN PRINT AND/OR ON LINE TO EDUCATORS AND DECISION-MAKERS IN THEOLOGICAL EDUCATION, HIGHER EDUCATION, THE RESEARCH COMMUNITY AND THE PRESS.

Dsc: CPCC PRESS SUPPORTS THE EFFORTS OF CPCC FACULTY, STAFF AND SELECTED COMMUNITY AUTHORS IN THE PUBLICATION OF ACADEMIC WORKS.WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT SERVICES AND EVENTS ARE MULTI-FACETED AND BASED ON CLIENT, INDUSTRY AND MARKET DEMANDS. STRATEGIC CONSULTING THAT ALIGNS HUMAN RESOURCE INITIATIVES TO THE ORGANIZATION'S MISSION AND STRATEGIC PRIORITIES. THE DELIVERY OF SEMINARS, CONFERENCES, WORKSHOPS OR OTHER WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT EVENTS.COMMUNITY CAMPUS ONLINE (CCO) IS A FEE-BASED, E-LEARNING PLATFORM DESIGNED AND MAINTAINED TO HOST ONLINE TRAINING THAT CAN BE RESOLD AT PARTNER INSTITUTIONS. ESL INSTRUCTOR FAST TRACK TRAINING IS AN EIGHT-WEEK ONLINE COURSE, FOCUSING SPECIFICALLY ON ADULT ESL LITERACY AND LEARNING.SAT PREPARATION PROGRAM IS FOR HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS. IT IS COMPRISED OF FACE-TO-FACE SESSIONS ON FOUR SATURDAYS, 9:00 A.M. - 1:00 P.M., IN LABS AT LEVINE AND NORTH CAMPUSES. THE PROGRAM HAS ONLINE AND HARD-COPY PRACTICE, FEEDBACK, AND TESTING COMPONENTS, PUBLISHED BY COLLEGE BOARD AND DEVELOPED IN-HOUSE. THE PROGRAM IS TAUGHT BY EXPERIENCED INSTRUCTORS OF DEVELOPMENTAL ENGLISH AND MATHEMATICS.FSI EDUCATIONAL VENDORS IS A SERIES OF TAX SEMINARS OFFERED THROUGH A THIRD PARTY VENDOR.

column5: STUDENT ACTVITIES.

AUXILIARY SERVICES - AUXILIARY SERVICES INCLUDES STUDENT HOUSING AND CAMPUS DINING. THE UNIVERSITY OFFERS FOUR CAMPUS RESIDENCE HALL OPTIONS, AS WELL AS NEARBY OFF-SITE HOUSING (IF NEEDED). HOUSING INCLUDES A VARIETY OF OPTIONS RANGING FROM SUITES TO SINGLE ROOMS. THE STUDENT MEAL PLAN CAN BE TAILORED FOR A NUMBER OF FLEX MEAL ARRANGEMENTS AND CAN BE USED AT SEVERAL CAMPUS DINING FACILITIES. APPROXIMATELY 40% OF THE STUDENTS UNDERGRADUATE POPULATION TAKES ADVANTAGES OF HOUSING OPPORTUNITIES. AUXILIARY SERVICES ALSO INCLUDES THE ACTIVITY OF THE PERFORMING ARTS CENTER, WHICH OFFERS A VARIETY OF MUSICAL AND THEATER ACTS TO THE UNIVERSITY AND NEARBY COMMUNITIES. THEATER PRODUCTIONS ARE INTEGRATED WITH THE UNDERGRADUATE THEATER PROGRAM AND UTILIZE MANY STUDENTS AS PART OF THE PRODUCTIONS. THEATER STUDENTS ALSO LEARN AND ASSIST WITH BOX OFFICE, STAGE CREW, AND AUDIENCE/GUEST ARTIST, AND SUPPORT ALL MUSICAL EVENTS.

column6: AUXILIARY SERVICES AT THE UNIVERSITY OF TAMPA OFFER THE STUDENTS DINING, A BOOKSTORE, STUDENT LIFE SERVICES AND VARIOUS ACTIVITIES. THE PURPOSE OF THE AUXILIARY SERVICES OFFICE IS TO PROVIDE THE STUDENTS WITH SERVICES AND ACTIVITIES THAT TAKE PLACE OUTSIDE THE CLASSROOM, ENHANCING LIFE AT THE UNIVERSITY. DINING SERVICES OFFER A VARIETY OF DINING VENUES FOR THE STUDENTS AND VISITORS. CAMPUS HOUSING IS LIMITED AND IS OFFERED ONLY TO FULL TIME STUDENTS. THE UNIVERSITY OF TAMPA HAS ELEVEN RESIDENTIAL HALLS FROM WHICH TO CHOOSE. VARIOUS ATHLETIC PROGRAMS ARE ALSO OFFERED FOR THE STUDENTS.

INSTITUTIONAL SUPPORT INCLUDES THE COST OF MAINTAINING THE OFFICES OF MARKETING, ADMISSIONS, REGISTRARS, FINANCIAL AID, BURSAR, STUDENT SERVICES, CAREER SERVICES, COMPUTER SYSTEMS, AND ADMINISTRATIVE SUPPORT TO PROVIDE ALL THE REQUIRED SERVICE AND GUIDANCE FROM INCEPTION THROUGH GRADUATION FOR ALL STUDENTS WHO APPLY TO THE COLLEGE FOR ADMISSION INTO THE VARIOUS PROGRAMS OF STUDY. SERVICES ARE ALSO PROVIDED TO ALUMNI OF THE COLLEGE.
